[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Buffer overflow] Can an attacker craft a malicious EventKey with oversized serialized data that causes the encoded buffer to exceed expected bounds, leading to memory corruption or panics when writing to RocksDB? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Integer overflow] If version or seq_num are set to u64::MAX, does the BigEndian encoding combined with EventKey bytes cause buffer size calculations to overflow, potentially corrupting adjacent memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [State corruption] Can an attacker provide invalid EventKey data that serializes successfully via to_bytes() but creates non-deterministic encoded keys across different nodes, causing database inconsistencies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Denial of service] Does event_key.to_bytes() have any cases where BCS serialization could panic or allocate excessive memory for malformed EventKey structures, allowing DoS attacks during indexing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Key collision] Can two different (EventKey, Version, SeqNum) tuples encode to the same byte sequence due to BCS serialization ambiguities, allowing event overwrites or index corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Endianness attack] Does the BigEndian encoding of version and seq_num create any vulnerabilities if an attacker manipulates byte order during serialization, potentially causing incorrect index ordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker create an EventKey with maximum creation_number and account_address values that, when combined with u64::MAX for version and seq_num, causes excessive memory allocation during encoding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Data truncation] If write_u64::<BigEndian> fails mid-write for version or seq_num, is the partial encoded buffer left in an inconsistent state that could corrupt the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Buffer underflow] Can an attacker store a deliberately truncated key in the database that passes ensure_slice_len_eq but causes read_u64::<BigEndian> to read beyond valid memory boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [BCS deserialization attack] Can malicious BCS-encoded EventKey bytes (first EVENT_KEY_LEN bytes) cause bcs::from_bytes to panic, deserialize to incorrect values, or consume excessive CPU, creating DoS vectors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Slice calculation error] Are the slice boundaries EVENT_KEY_LEN and EVENT_KEY_AND_VER_LEN computed correctly using size_of, or could struct padding cause incorrect offsets leading to reading wrong data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Integer bounds violation] When reading version and seq_num via read_u64, can corrupted database entries with values outside valid ranges bypass validation and corrupt in-memory state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Validation bypass] Does ensure_slice_len_eq properly validate that data length equals size_of::<Self>(), or can attackers provide data with correct length but invalid internal structure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Concurrent read corruption] If multiple threads read from EventByVersionSchema concurrently while writes are happening, can race conditions cause decode_key to read partially written keys and return corrupted data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Type confusion] Can an attacker manipulate the EventKey portion to contain data that deserializes to a valid EventKey structure but represents a completely different event stream, causing authorization bypass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Endianness vulnerability] Does BigEndian decoding assume correct byte order in stored data, or can byte-swapped corrupted entries cause version/seq_num to be interpreted as vastly different values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Panic on invalid data] If the database contains corrupted entries from disk failure or malicious tampering, does decode_key handle all error cases gracefully or can it panic and crash the node? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Index overflow] Can an attacker create events at index positions beyond u64::MAX-1, causing to_be_bytes() to wrap or the encoding to become ambiguous? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Determinism violation] Is to_be_bytes() guaranteed to produce identical output across all validator nodes for the same index value, or can platform differences cause non-deterministic encoding? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Memory allocation] Does to_vec() properly handle the 8-byte array allocation, or can repeated encoding operations cause memory fragmentation or exhaustion during high-throughput event processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Length validation bypass] Does ensure_slice_len_eq correctly validate the value is exactly size_of::<Self>() (8 bytes), or can shorter/longer values bypass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Index bounds violation] Can a stored index value of u64::MAX be decoded and used to access event arrays, causing out-of-bounds access when looking up events at that index? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Concurrent modification] If the database value is being written while decode_value is reading, can partial reads cause read_u64 to return corrupted index values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Endianness corruption] Does BigEndian decoding handle corrupted database entries where bytes are in wrong order, or will it silently decode to incorrect index values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Type: Key] [Type confusion] Can the (EventKey, Version, SeqNum) tuple be confused with keys from other schemas due to similar structure, causing cross-schema data corruption? (High)
